KitKat::

She ran down the hall and turned the corner, following him.  She 
entered into the engine area. She stopped and sniffed the ground, He 
was near, but how near. She waited a few seconds. Her clone in bot 
mode came running up. She sent the message for the clone to stay and 
guard the entrance. The fox had boxed himself in. And she wanted to 
take advantage of it. She kept her nose to the ground an followed the 
scent trail.  "OK Foxy. I know your here." She smiled. "You know fox, 
I am curious about something. Why sneek in here and steel stuff from 
my lab?" She then stopped in her tracks. She growled at herself 
remembering her oath to the little furball. She swore not to harm 
him. She growled at herself for saying something like that. In the 
future, she would have to guard her words more closely. 
"Foxy, I know you can hear me. I..I gave you my word that I wouldn't 
harm you. And.." she lowered her head. She said in a dissappointed 
voice. "ANd I will keep it. I will not harm you. Autoguns, disengage."

The autoguns dissarmed. She sat down on her hind legs and looked 
around she knew he was in one of the many rooms in this area. She 
sighed. "I will not harm you or let you come to harm. I gave you 
word. If nothing else, I shall keep my word. I am a bot of honor. 
Despite how I feel about it. You foxy will not be harmed. I didn't 
fire the autoguns on you nor will I." She layed down, but kept her 
head up. "I shall wait here Fox, I wish to speak to you."

She knew that if he was foolish enough to set off a charge in there, 
he'd be dead, and so would she.  



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Foxfingers ran down the hall with the Wolf on his heels. "Turn 
myself 
> over?" he asked laughing, "But I'm not done on this side yet." He 
> wagged his tail in the air taunting his hosts."I should be fine as 
> long as they don't have autoguns down here."
> 
> As if on cue he heard the familiar whir and click that the autoguns 
> made. "Oh recycled waste." he shouted as he put on the breaks. He 
> slid ahead on the smooth surface and stopped about a foot from an 
> autogun barrel. It didn't fire. That only meant that these Preds 
> didn't want him dead yet. He scampered into the nearest unlocked 
> door. He found himself in the engine room. A wrong turn but an 
> acceptable one. He ducked behind one of the machines as the 
autoguns 
> in the hall followed. "They wouldn't dare fire at me while I'm in 
> here. he thought. If an autogun caused a leak in the engine there'd 
> be noone left.
>
